title: Christian Bale looks suave as he takes his family to the Paris premiere of new film Le Mans 66
text:
He's known for his intense method acting on screen, but Christian Bale showed he's a true family man at the premiere for his new film.

The Batman star was joined by his wife Sibi Blažić, 49, and their two children at the Paris event for his upcoming movie Le Mans 66 on Sunday night.

Donning a suave all black ensemble Christian, 45, looked dapper as he greeted fans alongside co-star Matt Damon.

Dapper: Christian Bale, 45, opted for an all black ensemble for the Paris premiere of his new film Le Mans 66 on Sunday night

Christian kept his look classic in a chic suit, which he wore over a black shirt with no tie.

He channeled his Dark Knight past in the outfit, which was completed with a pair of black leather dress shoes and a belt.

The British actor's wife and five-year-old son Joseph appeared to have matched their outfits to his.

Family support: Christian's wife Sibi Blažić and their two children, including son Joseph, were also in attendance

Smiles: A smartly dressed Matt Damon was full of smiles as he greeted fans at the premiere

Proud: His daughter Emmaline Bale wore a pretty pink dress to her father's Paris premiere

Sibi, who has been married to Christian for almost two decades, opted for a fitted knee-length black dress and wore her brown hair down.

Joseph looked equally smart in a black shirt and trousers, just like his father, and was seen sweetly holding his mother's hand as they arrived at the premiere.

Christian and Sibi's teenager daughter Emmaline, 14, wore a pretty pink ruffled dress which had a statement black bow on the front.

Fans: Christian took some time to sign autographs outside the venue on Sunday night

All black: The Bales appeared to have coordinated their outfits with Sibi and Joseph, left, also opting for black and Emmaline's dress featuring a black bow. Christian is pictured right

Suave: Christian embraced his Dark Knight past for his sophisticated ensemble in Paris

She also rocked a pair of black boots at the premiere and wore her hair down, like her mother.

Also at the event was 48-year-old co-star Matt Damon, who looked equally dapper in a striped navy suit jacket and shirt.

Matt smiled as he signed autographs and laughed with fans outside the venue.

A-list co-star: All eyes were on Matt as he greeted fans at the premiere

Merch: One person handed Matt a Le Mans 66 poster to sign outside the Paris location

Christian and Matt's upcoming film tells the story of British driver Ken Miles and car designer Carroll Shelby.

The pair teamed up to create a race car for Ford Motor Company which could take on the dominating vehicles of Enzo Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

Although known as Le Mans 66 in the UK, the film will be called Ford v Ferrari in America.

The race, which still exists today, is the world's oldest active sports car race in endurance racing, held annually since 1923 near the town of Le Mans, France.

Man in black: Christian appeared at ease as he mingled with supporters before the premiere

Real stars: Several winners of the real 24 Hours of Le Mans attended the premiere. Pictured left to right are Henri Pescarolo (33 participation at the race, Gerard Larrousse (8 times winner), Pierre Fillon, actor Matt Damon, director James Mangold, actor Christian Bale, Benoit Treluyer, Tom Kristensen (9 times winners of the race) and Dereck Bell (5 times winner at Le Mans)

Several competitors of the event were at the Paris premiere on Sunday including eight times winner Gerard Larrousse and nine times winner Tom Kristensen.

Last night German models including Caro Daur and Leonie Hanne attended the Zurich premiere for the hotly anticipated racing film.

Also at the star-studded night was actress Zendaya and Formula 1 driver Lewis Hamilton.

Duo: Matt and Christian looked equally smart at the event and play British driver Ken Miles and car designer Carroll Shelby in the upcoming film

Teamwork: Matt and Christian posed for a picture with director James Mangold at the event
description: Christian Bale, 45, was supported by his wife Sibi Blažić, 49, and their two children Emmaline and Joseph at the premiere of his new film with Matt Damon in Paris, France, on Sunday.
